channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Bernadette Walker: Stepdad jailed for murdering teen over abuse claim
item.description: Scott Walker is jailed for a minimum of 32 years for killing Bernadette Walker, who called him "Dad".

item.title: Cressida Dick: Police Federation backs Met Police commissioner
item.description: The Police Federation says "it is easy to comment and criticise from the side-lines".

item.title: Old Trafford stabbing: Boy, 16, dies after being attacked in street
item.description: Two unknown males stabbed the teenager in Norton Street, Old Trafford on Thursday, police say.

item.title: Wiltshire PCC criticises Stonewall trans policy on women-only areas
item.description: Wiltshire chief Philip Wilkinson says it "is a matter of public security and not inclusiveness".

item.title: Metal detectorist's Bronze Age find on display for first time
item.description: The sun pendant is one of the most important finds of the last 100 years, the British Museum says.

item.title: Plea to religious leaders follows fiancÃ©'s suicide
item.description: The partner of a gay man from a religious family who killed himself is trying to spark change.

item.title: Patients verbally abused in front of inspectors
item.description: A care home has been told to make "urgent improvements" after abuse by staff went unreported.

item.title: Autistic boy knocked unconscious by fellow students
item.description: Jeremiah required hospital treatment after being attacked on his way home from school.

item.title: 'HGV driving is a good career, especially for ladies'
item.description: More than 100,000 lorry drivers are needed to meet a national shortage which is causing stock delays.

item.title: Chelsea Flower Show: Pumpkins as event held in autumn for first time
item.description: It is the first time in 108 years the world-famous event will be held in the autumn.

item.title: Rio Ferdinand: 'I have to explain the monkey emoji to my kids'
item.description: Former England footballer Rio Ferdinand tells MPs about his experience of online hate and racism.

item.title: Blackpool sailor gets medal for LGBT maritime diversity work
item.description: Paul Owen is the first recipient of the Merchant Navy Medal for LGBT+ work in the maritime sector.

item.title: The rapper giving away school uniforms to kids on free school meals
item.description: Inspired by Marcus Rashford, Jords has donated over 100 blazers to children on free school meals.

item.title: Leicestershire sisters on track for Olympic glory
item.description: Indienne and Shaikira have both recently been crowned national champions.

item.title: 9/11: 'All we could see was smoke in the distance'
item.description: A couple reflect on how close they came to being caught up in the devastation of the 9/11 attacks.

item.title: Bury St Edmunds mental health unit 'failed' man who took own life
item.description: Insufficient staffing levels contributed to the 25-year-old's death, an inquest jury finds.

item.title: Slough: Extra police powers after gangs roam streets
item.description: The Section 60 order is due to end 23:00 BST on Friday but will be reviewed by police later.

item.title: Newcastle goalkeeper Karl Darlow urges players to get vaccinated for Covid-19
item.description: Newcastle United goalkeeper Karl Darlow says footballers should get vaccinated for Covid-19 after suffering a serious bout himself.

item.title: Greene King's Black Boy pub renamed as The Shinfield Arms
item.description: Greene King said it changed the name because of a perception it was "linked with racism".

item.title: Tetney Golf Club Bronze Age coffin to be displayed
item.description: Experts begin two years of painstaking work to ready the 4,000-year-old relic for a museum exhibit.

item.title: US Open: Emma Raducanu says reaching final is 'crazy, cool and absolutely mind-blowing'
item.description: British teenager Emma Raducanu says reaching her first Grand Slam final at the US Open feels "crazy, cool and absolutely mind-blowing".

item.title: England v India: Fifth Test at Old Trafford cancelled amid Covid-19 concerns
item.description: The final Test between England and India at Emirates Old Trafford is cancelled, with the result of the series yet to be decided.

item.title: Keely Hodgkinson: GB teenager wins Diamond League 800m title to cap extraordinary year
item.description: British teenager Keely Hodgkinson wins the Diamond League 800m title to bank $30,000 in prize money and cap an extraordinary year.

item.title: Azeem Rafiq: Report by Yorkshire finds former player was "victim of racial harassment and bullying"
item.description: Azeem Rafiq was the "victim of racial harassment and bullying," according to the findings of a report released by his former club Yorkshire.

item.title: Emma Raducanu: The making of Great Britain's US Open finalist
item.description: As British teenager Emma Raducanu reached the US Open final, BBC Sport charts her rapid rise - with the help of a host of experts.
